title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point the supporting work must include at least a difference and a quotient.

Simplification is not required to earn the first point. If the numerical value is simplified, it must be correct.

The second point can be earned with an incorrect approximation for r ″ ( 8.5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F77@ but cannot be earned without some value for r ″ ( 8.5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F77@ presented.

Units may be written in any equivalent form (such as cm / day 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E97@ ).
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point, the response must establish that − 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaaaa@3C3A@ is between r ′  ( 0 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD3@ and r ′  ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD6@ (or − 6.1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaiaac6cacaaIXaaaaa@3DA7@ and −5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaI1aaaaa@3AA8@ ). This statement may be represented symbolically (with or without including one or both endpoints in an inequality) or verbally. A response of “ r ′  ( t )=− 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4256@ because r ′  ( 0 )=− 6.1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4384@ and r ′  ( 3 )=−5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4088@ ” does not state that − 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaaaa@3C3A@ is between − 6.1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaiaac6cacaaIXaaaaa@3DA7@ and −5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@3B5A@ Thus this response does not earn the first point.

To earn the second point:

· The response must state that r ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E12@ is continuous because r ′  ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E12@ is differentiable (or because r ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E06@ is twice differentiable).

· The response must have earned the first point. Exception: A response of “ r ′  ( t )=− 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4256@ because r ′  ( 0 )=− 6.1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4384@ and r ′  ( 3 )=−5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4088@ ” does not earn the first point because of imprecise communication but may nonetheless earn the second point if all other criteria for the second point are met.

· The response must conclude that there is a time t such that r ′  ( t )=− 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4256@ (A statement of “yes” would be sufficient.)

To earn the second point, the response need not explicitly name the Intermediate Value Theorem, but if a theorem is named, it must be correct.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point, at least seven of the eight factors in the Riemann sum must be correct. If there is any error in the Riemann sum, the response does not earn the second point.

A response of 3( −5.0 )+4( − 4.4 )+3( −3.8 )+2( −3.5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52B6@ earns both the first and second points, unless there is a subsequent error in simplification, in which case the response would earn only the first point.

A response that presents the correct answer, with accompanying work that shows the four products in the Riemann sum (without explicitly showing all of the factors and/or the sum process) does not earn the first point but earns the second point. For example, −15+4( − 4.4 )+3( −3.8 )+−7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4C0D@ does not earn the first point but earns the second point. Similarly, −15,−17.6,− 11.4,− 7→−51 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@55EF@ does not earn the first point but earns the second point.

A response that presents the correct answer ( −51 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaI1aGaaGymaaaa@3B63@ ) with no supporting work earns no points.

A response that provides a completely correct left Riemann sum and approximation ∫ 0 12 r ′  ( t )  dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4700@ (i.e., 3 r ′  ( 0 )+4 r ′  ( 3 )+3 r ′  ( 7 )+2 r ′  ( 10 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@52B6@ =3( − 6.1 )+4( −5.0 )+3( − 4.4 )+2( −3.8 )=−59.1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5A2E@ ) earns 1 of the 2 points.

A response that has any error in a left Riemann sum or evaluation for ∫ 0 12 r ′  ( t )  dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4700@ earns no points.

Units are not required or read in this part.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first 2 points could be earned in either order.

A response with a completely correct product rule, missing one or both of the correct differentials, earns the product rule point, but not the chain rule point.

For example, dV dt = 2 3 πrh+ 1 3 π r 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48E9@ earns the first point, but not the second.

A response that treats r or h (but not both) as a constant is eligible for the chain rule point but not the product rule point. For example, dV dt = 2 3 πrh dr dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46B4@ is correct if h is constant, and thus earns the chain rule point.

Note: Neither dV dt = 2 3 πr dh dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45BD@ nor dV dt = 2 3 πrh dr dt dh dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A7C@ earns any points.

A response that assumes a functional relationship between r and h (such as r=2h MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGYbGaeyypa0JaaGOmaiaadIgaaaa@3CA2@ ), and uses this relationship to create a function for volume in terms of one variable, is eligible for at most the chain rule point. For example, r=2h  →  V= 1 3 π ( 2h ) 2 h= 4 3 π h 3   →   dV dt =4π h 2 dh dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6A2A@ earns only the chain rule point.

A response that mishandles the constant 1 3 π MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIZaaaaiabec8aWbaa@3C41@ cannot earn the third point but is eligible for the first 2 points.

The third point cannot be earned without both of the first 2 points.

dV dt = 2 3 π( 100 )( 50 )( −5 )+ 1 3 π ( 100 ) 2 ( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@56F0@ earns all 3 points.

Units are not required or read in this part.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.
